item.title: advanced visualization studio
item.description: A looooong time ago around 2006 I began using AVS - Advanced Visualization Studio which came with the famous Winamp Media player. Winamp came with 2 visualization plugins - Milkdrop and AVS. The music visualizations used input from the music to create procedural art. The user could choose from a variety of presets. With AVS users could create their own presets, because AVS is its own little programming environment. As it compiles your code everytime you change something changes to the code can be seen in realtime.
